text: is a Japanese city in Kanagawa Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kawasaki" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 499. Kawasaki is one of three ordinance-designated cities in Kanagawa. ==History== In the Edo period, Kawasaki-juku was 2nd of the 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, "Tōkaidō" at p. 973. ==Geography== Kawasaki occupies a belt of land stretching about 30 km along the south bank of the Tama River. The river forms its boundary with Tokyo. == Wards == In Kawasaki, there are seven wards: *Kawasaki *Saiwai *Nakahara *Takatsu *Tama *Miyamae *Aso ==Related pages== * The Fifty- three Stations of the Tōkaidō * Kawasaki Frontale ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.kawasaki.jp/index_e.htm , Category:Cities in Kanagawa Prefecture
title: Kawasaki, Kanagawa
